member.name: MF_MEDIA_ENGINE_EVENT
member.summary: Defines event codes for the Media Engine.

member.name: MF_MEDIA_ENGINE_EVENT.MF_MEDIA_ENGINE_EVENT_LOADSTART
member.summary: The Media Engine has started to load the source. See .

member.name: MF_MEDIA_ENGINE_EVENT.MF_MEDIA_ENGINE_EVENT_PROGRESS
member.summary: The Media Engine is loading the source.

member.name: MF_MEDIA_ENGINE_EVENT.MF_MEDIA_ENGINE_EVENT_SUSPEND
member.summary: The Media Engine has suspended a load operation.

member.name: MF_MEDIA_ENGINE_EVENT.MF_MEDIA_ENGINE_EVENT_ABORT
member.summary: The Media Engine cancelled a load operation that was in progress.

listheader.description: An HRESULT error code, or zero.

member.name: MF_MEDIA_ENGINE_EVENT.MF_MEDIA_ENGINE_EVENT_EMPTIED
member.summary: The Media Engine has switched to the MF_MEDIA_ENGINE_NETWORK_EMPTY state. This can occur when the method is called, or if an error occurs during the Load method. See .

member.name: MF_MEDIA_ENGINE_EVENT.MF_MEDIA_ENGINE_EVENT_STALLED
member.summary: The algorithm is stalled, waiting for data.

member.name: MF_MEDIA_ENGINE_EVENT.MF_MEDIA_ENGINE_EVENT_PLAY
member.summary: The Media Engine is switching to the playing state. See .

member.name: MF_MEDIA_ENGINE_EVENT.MF_MEDIA_ENGINE_EVENT_PAUSE
member.summary: The media engine has paused. See .

member.name: MF_MEDIA_ENGINE_EVENT.MF_MEDIA_ENGINE_EVENT_LOADEDMETADATA
member.summary: The Media Engine has loaded enough source data to determine the duration and dimensions of the source.

member.name: MF_MEDIA_ENGINE_EVENT.MF_MEDIA_ENGINE_EVENT_LOADEDDATA
member.summary: The Media Engine has loaded enough data to render some content (for example, a video frame).

member.name: MF_MEDIA_ENGINE_EVENT.MF_MEDIA_ENGINE_EVENT_WAITING
member.summary: Playback has stopped because the next frame is not available.

member.name: MF_MEDIA_ENGINE_EVENT.MF_MEDIA_ENGINE_EVENT_PLAYING
member.summary: Playback has started. See .

member.name: MF_MEDIA_ENGINE_EVENT.MF_MEDIA_ENGINE_EVENT_CANPLAY
member.summary: Playback can start, but the Media Engine might need to stop to buffer more data.

member.name: MF_MEDIA_ENGINE_EVENT.MF_MEDIA_ENGINE_EVENT_CANPLAYTHROUGH
member.summary: The Media Engine can probably play through to the end of the resource, without stopping to buffer data.

member.name: MF_MEDIA_ENGINE_EVENT.MF_MEDIA_ENGINE_EVENT_SEEKING
member.summary: The Media Engine has started seeking to a new playback position. See .

member.name: MF_MEDIA_ENGINE_EVENT.MF_MEDIA_ENGINE_EVENT_SEEKED
member.summary: The Media Engine has seeked to a new playback position. See .

member.name: MF_MEDIA_ENGINE_EVENT.MF_MEDIA_ENGINE_EVENT_TIMEUPDATE
member.summary: The playback position has changed. See .

member.name: MF_MEDIA_ENGINE_EVENT.MF_MEDIA_ENGINE_EVENT_ENDED
member.summary: Playback has reached the end of the source. This event is not sent if the is TRUE.

member.name: MF_MEDIA_ENGINE_EVENT.MF_MEDIA_ENGINE_EVENT_RATECHANGE
member.summary: The playback rate has changed. See .

member.name: MF_MEDIA_ENGINE_EVENT.MF_MEDIA_ENGINE_EVENT_DURATIONCHANGE
member.summary: The duration of the media source has changed. See .

member.name: MF_MEDIA_ENGINE_EVENT.MF_MEDIA_ENGINE_EVENT_VOLUMECHANGE
member.summary: The audio volume changed. See .

summary.para: The output format of the media source has changed.

listheader.description: Zero if the video format changed, 1 if the audio format changed.

member.name: MF_MEDIA_ENGINE_EVENT.MF_MEDIA_ENGINE_EVENT_PURGEQUEUEDEVENTS
member.summary: The Media Engine flushed any pending events from its queue.

member.name: MF_MEDIA_ENGINE_EVENT.MF_MEDIA_ENGINE_EVENT_TIMELINE_MARKER
member.summary: The playback position reached a timeline marker. See .

member.name: MF_MEDIA_ENGINE_EVENT.MF_MEDIA_ENGINE_EVENT_BALANCECHANGE
member.summary: The audio balance changed. See .

member.name: MF_MEDIA_ENGINE_EVENT.MF_MEDIA_ENGINE_EVENT_DOWNLOADCOMPLETE
member.summary: The Media Engine has finished downloading the source data.

member.name: MF_MEDIA_ENGINE_EVENT.MF_MEDIA_ENGINE_EVENT_BUFFERINGSTARTED
member.summary: The media source has started to buffer data.

member.name: MF_MEDIA_ENGINE_EVENT.MF_MEDIA_ENGINE_EVENT_BUFFERINGENDED
member.summary: The media source has stopped buffering data.

member.name: MF_MEDIA_ENGINE_EVENT.MF_MEDIA_ENGINE_EVENT_FRAMESTEPCOMPLETED
member.summary: The method completed.

summary.para: The Media Engine's algorithm is waiting to start.

listheader.description: A handle to a waitable event, of type HANDLE.

summary.para: If Media Engine is created with the MF_MEDIA_ENGINE_WAITFORSTABLE_STATE flag, the Media Engine sends the MF_MEDIA_ENGINE_EVENT_NOTIFYSTABLESTATE event at the start of the algorithm. The param1 parameter is a handle to a waitable event. The Load thread waits for the application to signal the event by calling .
If the Media Engine is not created with the MF_MEDIA_ENGINE_WAITFORSTABLE_STATE, it does not send this event, and the thread does not wait to be signalled.

member.name: MF_MEDIA_ENGINE_EVENT.MF_MEDIA_ENGINE_EVENT_FIRSTFRAMEREADY
member.summary: The first frame of the media source is ready to render.

summary.para: Raised when a new track is added or removed.
Raised when there is new information about the Output Protection Manager (OPM).
This event will be raised when an OPM failure occurs, but ITA allows fallback without the OPM. In this case, constriction can be applied.
This event will not be raised when there is an OPM failure and the fallback also fails. For example, if ITA blocks playback entirely when OPM cannot be established.

member.name: MF_MEDIA_ENGINE_EVENT.MF_MEDIA_ENGINE_EVENT_STREAMRENDERINGERROR
member.summary: Raised when one of the component streams of a media stream fails. This event is only raised if the media stream contains other component streams that did not fail.
